The full statement from @PPFA's @danasingiser is here: #CDC7words #CDC https://t.co/6PIxwbHLRC
Bottom line: Trump and Pence are using the federal government to try and control women’s bodies and erase LGBTQ people and people of color. We cannot let it stand. #CDC7words #CDC
You cannot erase health inequities faced by people of color simply by forbidding the use of the words ‘vulnerable’ or ‘diversity’. https://t.co/DSnnqhve4P #CDC7words #CDC
You must be able to acknowledge the humanity of transgender people in order to address their health care needs. https://t.co/DSnnqhve4P #CDC7words #CDC
You must be able to talk about science and evidence if you are to research cures for infectious diseases such as Ebola. https://t.co/DSnnqhve4P #CDC7words #CDC
You cannot fight against the Zika virus, or improve women’s and fetal health, if you are unable to use the word ‘fetus.’ https://t.co/ysAyWxytcs #CDC
This #CDC edict doesn’t just mean a change in vocabulary. It means the Trump-Pence administration is trying to make a radical change in the focus of the entire agency. https://t.co/jrHoJpR4V4

Here's @PPFA's full statement in opposition to the FCC repeal of #NetNeutality: https://t.co/6lKeEmoy18
Repealing #NetNeutality will make it harder for millions of people to answer the questions they have about their sexual health.

The internet is a lifeline for young people without sex ed, for LGBTQ youth growing up in hostile environments, for women who need to access reproductive health care. By repealing #NetNeutality, the FCC just took that lifeline away.
Today the FCC repealed #NetNeutality -- and yes, that should be terrifying news for anyone who cares about democracy, information, or innovation.

RT @AndrewTaverrite: @nytopinion This is a garbage column and completely misses the impact abortion bans have on women.

@nytopinion Not to mention the bill Brooks talks about in his piece was based on made up "facts," had no basis in science, and had no exception for a woman's health and inadequate protections for survivors of rape. But sure Brooks, voting for that bill is a winning strategy.
@nytopinion Also, the same women who need access to abortion, an estimated 1 in 4 in America, vote. You don't think they'd abandon politicians who abandoned them and their health care?

@nytopinion This piece does a great job of COMPLETELY IGNORING the women who would be hurt by banning abortion. It also ignores the fact that 70% of Americans support access to abortion -- more than support either Republicans OR Democrats...
